intro: Cistanthe pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf cistanthe, is a small flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and yellow or orange, and it produces a distinctive seed capsule that splits open when mature. Cistanthe pygmaea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and drought tolerance.
